title: Chrissy Teigen jokes she livestreams just to freak out her publicist
text:
Instagram Live has proved itself a quick and easy way for celebrities to connect with fans.

But Chrissy Teigen joked that publicists were 'freaking out' about their clients livestreaming, in the wake of Miley Cyrus's controversial comments.

Taking to Twitter on Tuesday, Chrissy joked: 'When I am sad or bored I like to log onto instagram live so the alert freaks out my publicist so I'm just gonna do that all day. Miley got them all on edge.'

Having fun on social media: Chrissy Teigen jokes she live streams just to freak out her publicist because 'Miley got them all on edge'

Having fun: Chrissy Teigen joked that publicists were 'freaking out' about their clients livestreaming, in the wake of Miley Cyrus's controversial comments

Miley enraged the LGBT community this week when she told her fans 'you don't have to be gay' and advised them they didn't have to 'give up' finding a good guy.

The bisexual Wrecking Ball hitmaker, who has enjoyed romances with both men and women, also said she thought she 'had to be gay' because all men were 'evil'.

Speaking in an Instagram Live alongside her new boyfriend Cody Simpson, she said: 'There are good people out there that just happen to have d***s. I've only ever met one, and he's on this live. There are good men out there, guys, don't give up. You don't have to be gay, there are good people with d***s out there, you've just got to find them.

Provocative: Miley enraged the LGBT community this week when she told her fans 'you don't have to be gay' and advised them they didn't have to 'give up' finding a good guy

'You've got to find a d**k that's not a d**k, you know. I always thought I had to be gay, because I thought all guys were evil, but it's not true. There are good people out there that just happen to have d***s. I've only ever met one, and he's on this live.'

Attempting some damage control, a repentant Miley clarified her controversial comments in a tweet on Monday, but she couldn't resist making another comment about her 'sucky' exes.

'I was talking s**t about sucky guys, but let me be clear, YOU don't CHOOSE your sexuality,' she tweeted. 'You are born as you are. It has always been my priority to protect the LGBTQ community I am a part of'.

Morning rant: Chrissy revealed that there were people who genuinely believed she and husband John Legend were linked to Jeffrey Epstein

'If I take legal action, it gets worse': Chrissy expressed her frustration with the trolls

Unbelieveable: The model said the 'pedo ring is always ALMOST about to be exposed'

Not just 'weirdos': Chrissy said many people believed the whispers

'Insane': Chrissy says she doesn't want to just ignore the 'crazy' people

Grammar police: Fans were quick to point out her missing word, not that Chrissy cared

Over and out: She called her Twitter chain her 'morning rant'

As for Chrissy, the mother-of-two also shared her 'morning rant', sounding off on trolls who suggested she and husband John Legend were somehow connected to the Jeffrey Epstein sex slave scandal.

'u know what is not great? I still have to read on social media many times a day that John and I are pedophiles and look at photoshopped/miscaptioned photos of us on 'Epstein Island' and I just have to deal with it because "people are crazy these days,"' she wrote.

'If I take legal action, it gets worse because then, to them, it's true and I'm trying to 'silence' them. It's on posts about anything. Random 90 days fan pages, meme accounts, anything. Even if the content is normal, the comments are....this s***.'
description: Instagram Live has proved itself a quick and easy way for celebrities to connect with fans.
